aboutAlternative.text:
- Apache Software Foundation: Apache Mesos Committer
- C++ Standards Committee

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description: Joined Mesosphere through the acquisition of OrlyAtomics as a member of the core team working on Apache Mesos, a distributed systems kernel. Major contributions to Apache Mesos include: introduction of persistence primitives to better support running stateful applications on Mesos, and C++11 upgrade of the codebase.

positions.title: Co-Founder
positions.description: One of the technical co-founders of OrlyAtomics. Orly is a large-scale distributed graph database with a distributed runtime environment, and a programming language. Major contributions to Orly include: design of the programming language, and implementation of the corresponding compiler.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern III
positions.description: Returned as a member of a team working on StigDB, a distributed graph database. Major contributions include: language design discussions related to the interaction between functional and logical paradigms, and the development of a library to better support algebraic data types in C++, similar to Boost.Variant.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description: Part of the cross-datacenter infrastructure team. Designed and implemented the end-to-end testing framework for Wormhole, a reliable pub-sub system to support geo-replicated internet services.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern II
positions.description: Joined as a member of a team working on StigDB, a distributed graph database. Contributed in the areas of language design, compiler construction, and internal technical support. Major contributions include implementation of the synthetic layer of the compiler which acted as the glue between the syntactic and semantic layer, and the semantic analysis layer of the compiler.

given.text: Michael is extremely enthusiastic and hardworking, which aids his ability to tackle whatever problems are thrown his way. He continually rises to the challenges given him. He finds good solutions to problems, and refuses to be satisfied by sub-optimal solutions. I found him to be an exceptional employee.

received.text: Erik is an exceptional mentor. He was very dependable in tough situations and was available for help even after work hours. He provided guidance and creative solutions that enhanced my skills and knowledge as an intern at Tagged. He was also very open-minded in listening to and exploring different approaches to solve a problem. He also let me have a great control over my project which helped me feel the sense of ownership of the project as well.

peopleAlsoViewed.text: C++ Community Leader, ISO C++ Library Incubator Chair, ISO C++ Tooling Chair, CUDA C++ Core Libraries Lead @ NVIDIA
Learning & Orgazational Developmenet Assistant at CJ America, Inc.
Software Engineer at FlightSafety International - Simulation
